page.title: 14LLOYD MAUNDERS MILL
page.content: Lloyd Maunders Mill Uffculme make eight different types of chicken meal. They make food for their own company and send it to the farms they own within a thirty mile radius of Uffculme. The firm began eighty years ago when Lloyd Maunder met John Sainsbury in London and decided to raise cattle and sheep in Devon to send to John Sainsbury for him to sell in his London shop. The mill in Uffculme was started a few years ago when building permission was refused in Willand. The site was originally a beatiful grist mill was completely gutted in a fire in ????. Sixteen peolple are now employed at the Mill and Maunder's chicken are sold to Sainsburys, Marks and Spencer and Tesco. Uffculme has a good central position but the narrow local roads do cause problems for the lorries.
